intro: Platylobium formosum var. typicum, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit and produces bright yellow flowers during the winter months. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and is part of the family Rhamnaceae. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to dry, sunny conditions. The golden wattle is also recognized as the floral emblem of Western Australia.
